snippet: A report by the Federal Highway Administration and a nonprofit group identified potential hazards in guardrails approved under old safety standards.
abstract: Report by Federal Highway Administration and American Association of State Highway and Transportation Officials finds thousands of guardrails made under old safety rules may be unsafe if hit by vehicles at certain angles or if they were not installed correctly.

byline.original: By DANIELLE IVORY and AARON M. KESSLER

lead_paragraph: A report by the Federal Highway Administration and a nonprofit group identified potential hazards in guardrails approved under old safety standards.

headline.main: Report Finds Vulnerabilities in Guardrails Lining U.S. Roads
headline.print_headline: Report Finds New Risks in Approved Guardrails

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Assn of State Highway and Transportation Officials
